title: AIML - Director of Machine Learning Applied Research, Data & ML Innovation
summary: We are looking to hire a senior technical leader with a strong record in leading applied research teams. You will lead and grow an organization accountable for building machine learning technologies to enable breakthrough experiences that make a real difference in the lives of hundreds of millions of users.
description: The Data and Machine Learning Innovation team focuses on innovative technologies, methodologies, and research to enable amazing user experiences and advance the frontier of machine learning at Apple. The team works broadly with Machine Learning teams across the company to advance capabilities. This role is highly multi-functional, and you will collaborate very closely with various highly skilled machine learning and software development teams to develop groundbreaking research and solutions for Apple products.
key_qualifications: 10+ years of combined management and professional experience in machine learning, research, and software engineering, and a proven record in running an applied research organization with product impacts. Strong organizational skills and experience working with large cross-functional and diverse teams. Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills. Experience in scientific computing, high-performance computing, applied machine learning, or deep learning. Strong in computer science fundamentals, software engineering principles and development methodologies. Experience with incubation, development and deployment of machine learning technologies into products. Ability to take ambiguous ideas from inception to deployment. Experience with setting and executing innovation strategies at both technical and organizational levels to drive research directions and business objectives.
education_experience: -  MS/PhD in Computer Science or equivalent
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $293,300 and $468,500, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
